So the goal, ultimately, is
to get rid of all the cards

1545.text:
in your hand, and when
you answer incorrectly,

1547.text:
you take, not only
back your card,

1550.text:
but you also take
back two more.

1551.text:
(Velvet)
Which is the punishment,
that's why we have

1553.text:
some always left over
from the answer deck.

1555.text:
(Laura)
Okay, well, we only have
about a minute left,

1557.text:
can we play a hand
real quick?

1561.text:
(Laura)
We got this one, let's take
it back just for now,

1564.text:
since that was just
a practice round.

1565.text:
(Velvet)
Let's do another one,
five times ten.

1571.text:
(Velvet)
As the judge, that was
a really close one.

1573.text:
I think Brittany
put it down first.

1577.text:
(Laura)
So what was the answer, Steph?

1582.text:
(Laura)
Let's do one or two more.

1588.text:
Time, sixty, good,
the answer's correct.

1594.text:
(Laura)
Go, go, go, go, go,
hurry, hurry!

1596.text:
(Velvet)
Thirty, good job, time,
that was great.

1609.text:
(Velvet)
And that was a danger card
so only that team

1613.text:
Yes, 25, so 25 is one
of the danger cards.

1616.text:
(Brittany)
And you see it written
in English and Spanish.

1618.text:
(Velvet)
The game is bilingual
so families can learn

1622.text:
their numbers if they don't
know the other language.

1625.text:
They can play
and they'll learn

1627.text:
at least a few things
in the other language.

1630.text:
We, our family, speak
both English and Spanish

1632.text:
so we wanted
to pass on that

1634.text:
and have everyone play
with two languages.

1639.text:
We're gonna keep playing,
but we'll see you next week,

1642.text:
as we continue our special
coverage of STEAM education.

1645.text:
Until then, remember
to focus on what matters.

1648.text:
-Can we keep playing?
-You did a fantastic job!
